doc.after: South Africa is located at the southernmost region of Africa, with a long coastline that stretches more than 2,500Â km (1,553Â mi) and along two oceans (the South Atlantic and the Indian). At 1,219,912Â km2 (471,011Â sqÂ mi),[53] South Africa is the 25th-largest country in the world and is comparable in size to Colombia. Mafadi in the Drakensberg at 3,450Â m (11,320Â ft) is the highest peak in South Africa. Excluding the Prince Edward Islands, the country lies between latitudes 22Â° and 35Â°S, and longitudes 16Â° and 33Â°E.
